values.title: Initial work on s3_upload

summary.html:
This should upload the package to the s3 instance. Configuration must be done manually into the node for the upload, currently master is the only one doing this.

I've found people running their own deb repository in s3 instances but seems like is always a sync from a local repository. I don't see too much benefit for it (a part from saving disk space).

@nkoenig, what do you think?

values.description:
To avoid the problems when generating the source package when we previously have pushed the repository tag (which end up in multiple commits with the same tag) I just moved it to run the last.

I also removed (in a previously commit, sorry) the confirmation message, since we have safety measures in place to check -release repo. All is now non-interactive.

FYI.

values.description:
In a3907ff, the default ogre package on recent distros was changed from `libogre1.8-dev` to `libogre1.9-dev`. Since support for ogre 1.9 was only recently added in gazebo5, this change caused some trusty builds to fail for the gazebo 3.x and 4.x branches:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/450/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/451/

I have proposed a fix here that will try to detect the gazebo major version and choose an ogre package accordingly. Here is a gazebo_3.1 build using this release-tools branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.1-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/28/

UPDATE: the build succeeded.
values.title: Try to detect the gazebo version and install a compatible ogre version

summary.raw:
In a3907ff, the default ogre package on recent distros was changed from `libogre1.8-dev` to `libogre1.9-dev`. Since support for ogre 1.9 was only recently added in gazebo5, this change caused some trusty builds to fail for the gazebo 3.x and 4.x branches:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/450/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/451/

I have proposed a fix here that will try to detect the gazebo major version and choose an ogre package accordingly. Here is a gazebo_3.1 build using this release-tools branch:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.1-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/28/

UPDATE: the build succeeded.
summary.html:
In a3907ff, the default ogre package on recent distros was changed from libogre1.8-dev to libogre1.9-dev. Since support for ogre 1.9 was only recently added in gazebo5, this change caused some trusty builds to fail for the gazebo 3.x and 4.x branches:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/450/
  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/451/

I have proposed a fix here that will try to detect the gazebo major version and choose an ogre package accordingly. Here is a gazebo_3.1 build using this release-tools branch:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_3.1-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/28/

UPDATE: the build succeeded.

values.description: When a new version of XCode is released, the homebrew dependencies are re-bottled, which is what massive numbers of gazebo test failures. Running `brew doctor` should provide a warning that the system needs to be updated.
values.title: run brew doctor to find out about configuration problems

summary.html: When a new version of XCode is released, the homebrew dependencies are re-bottled, which is what massive numbers of gazebo test failures. Running brew doctor should provide a warning that the system needs to be updated.

values.description:
Currently calling the release script successfully shows the following output:
~~~
release.py --dry-run stuff
ERROR: Missing command. Please run with --help for more information.
Dry-run running:
~~~
The `ERROR` comes from calling `s3cmd` with no arguments. This PR calls with `--version` so the output is more friendly:
~~~
release.py --dry-run stuff
s3cmd version 1.1.0-beta3
Dry-run running:
~~~
values.title: Test for s3cmd with --version so the console output on success is more friendly

summary.raw:
Currently calling the release script successfully shows the following output:
~~~
release.py --dry-run stuff
ERROR: Missing command. Please run with --help for more information.
Dry-run running:
~~~
The `ERROR` comes from calling `s3cmd` with no arguments. This PR calls with `--version` so the output is more friendly:
~~~
release.py --dry-run stuff
s3cmd version 1.1.0-beta3
Dry-run running:
~~~
summary.html:
Currently calling the release script successfully shows the following output:

release.py --dry-run stuff
ERROR: Missing command. Please run with --help for more information.
Dry-run running:

The ERROR comes from calling s3cmd with no arguments. This PR calls with --version so the output is more friendly:

release.py --dry-run stuff
s3cmd version 1.1.0-beta3
Dry-run running:

values.description:
Display detection wasn't working properly. Also, gazebo requires the DISPLAY variable to be set before the cmake invocation in order to run glxinfo, so I moved the detection forward.

I did some testing and found that Xquartz will start a unique X server for each user that wants it. We can force one to open with `open /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app` and then detect which one is ours by grepping the `ps ax` for our user name.

These improvements will start an X server if one isn't yet running, and should also detect the proper one if there are multiples running.

I've been testing this branch with the following jobs:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/
values.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

summary.raw:
Display detection wasn't working properly. Also, gazebo requires the DISPLAY variable to be set before the cmake invocation in order to run glxinfo, so I moved the detection forward.

I did some testing and found that Xquartz will start a unique X server for each user that wants it. We can force one to open with `open /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app` and then detect which one is ours by grepping the `ps ax` for our user name.

These improvements will start an X server if one isn't yet running, and should also detect the proper one if there are multiples running.

I've been testing this branch with the following jobs:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/
* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/
summary.html:
Display detection wasn't working properly. Also, gazebo requires the DISPLAY variable to be set before the cmake invocation in order to run glxinfo, so I moved the detection forward.

I did some testing and found that Xquartz will start a unique X server for each user that wants it. We can force one to open with open /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app and then detect which one is ours by grepping the ps ax for our user name.

These improvements will start an X server if one isn't yet running, and should also detect the proper one if there are multiples running.

I've been testing this branch with the following jobs:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/
  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/

values.title: Add libgraphviz-dev as gazebo extra dependency

values.description:
Before gazebo6, we were using the same sdformat formula for all versions of gazebo. Also, the gazebo dependencies were installed from the `gazebo.rb` formula. Now, gazebo6 requires sdformat3, so I added detection for the gazebo major version, so that it will install dependencies for the corresponding `gazeboN.rb` formula.

This requires an extra workspace symlink, since the source code is initially in `${WORKSPACE}/gazebo`, but the next script will expect it to be in `${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN`.
values.title: Identify GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION in gazebo homebrew builds

summary.raw:
Before gazebo6, we were using the same sdformat formula for all versions of gazebo. Also, the gazebo dependencies were installed from the `gazebo.rb` formula. Now, gazebo6 requires sdformat3, so I added detection for the gazebo major version, so that it will install dependencies for the corresponding `gazeboN.rb` formula.

This requires an extra workspace symlink, since the source code is initially in `${WORKSPACE}/gazebo`, but the next script will expect it to be in `${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN`.
summary.html:
Before gazebo6, we were using the same sdformat formula for all versions of gazebo. Also, the gazebo dependencies were installed from the gazebo.rb formula. Now, gazebo6 requires sdformat3, so I added detection for the gazebo major version, so that it will install dependencies for the corresponding gazeboN.rb formula.

This requires an extra workspace symlink, since the source code is initially in ${WORKSPACE}/gazebo, but the next script will expect it to be in ${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN.

values.title: Require ignition-math2

values.description:
Several changes going into this PR:

 * The main idea is to move docker scripts to default branch so they can share changes with pbuilder scripts. This will avoid problems with branch syncing.
 * The scripts are also using squid proxy, if available.
 * Docker should bring us speed benefits after the first build, since it has a nice caching system. For example, [sdformat testing job default branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-default-devel-trusty-amd64/13/) on tobor is taking  4min 46 secs. The [first build on docker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker-2/7/) takes about 5min 33secs while [the second one](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker-2/8/) takes 1min 59secs. Around ~40% faster.
values.title: Docker on default branch

summary.raw:
Several changes going into this PR:

 * The main idea is to move docker scripts to default branch so they can share changes with pbuilder scripts. This will avoid problems with branch syncing.
 * The scripts are also using squid proxy, if available.
 * Docker should bring us speed benefits after the first build, since it has a nice caching system. For example, [sdformat testing job default branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-default-devel-trusty-amd64/13/) on tobor is taking  4min 46 secs. The [first build on docker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker-2/7/) takes about 5min 33secs while [the second one](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64-docker-2/8/) takes 1min 59secs. Around ~40% faster.
summary.html:
Several changes going into this PR:

  • The main idea is to move docker scripts to default branch so they can share changes with pbuilder scripts. This will avoid problems with branch syncing.
  • The scripts are also using squid proxy, if available.
  • Docker should bring us speed benefits after the first build, since it has a nice caching system. For example, sdformat testing job default branch on tobor is taking 4min 46 secs. The first build on docker takes about 5min 33secs while the second one takes 1min 59secs. Around ~40% faster.

values.description:
For gazebo homebrew: make `${WORKSPACE}/gazebo` a symlink to `${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN` instead of the other way around. This will fix some gazebo tests that expect some test files in specific paths and are confused by symlinks.

* [LogPlay_TEST/Accessors test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/53/testReport/(root)/LogPlay_TEST/Accessors/)
* [SaveDialog_TEST/SaveLocation test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/53/testReport/(root)/SaveDialog_TEST/SaveLocation/)
values.title: Reverse symlinks in gazebo homebrew build

summary.raw:
For gazebo homebrew: make `${WORKSPACE}/gazebo` a symlink to `${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN` instead of the other way around. This will fix some gazebo tests that expect some test files in specific paths and are confused by symlinks.

* [LogPlay_TEST/Accessors test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/53/testReport/(root)/LogPlay_TEST/Accessors/)
* [SaveDialog_TEST/SaveLocation test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/53/testReport/(root)/SaveDialog_TEST/SaveLocation/)
summary.html:
For gazebo homebrew: make ${WORKSPACE}/gazebo a symlink to ${WORKSPACE}/gazeboN instead of the other way around. This will fix some gazebo tests that expect some test files in specific paths and are confused by symlinks.

  • LogPlay_TEST/Accessors test
  • SaveDialog_TEST/SaveLocation test

values.description:
I apologize; I should have tested pull request #85. The folder had already been symlinked, so moving it was a problem:
~~~
+ mv /Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew-amd64-2/gazebo /Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew-amd64-2/gazebo6
mv: rename /Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew-amd64-2/gazebo
 to /Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-default-devel-homebrew-amd64-2/gazebo6/gazebo:
 Invalid argument
~~~
I think it's better to copy the entire folder and clean it up each time.
values.title: Copy instead of move and link in gazebo-default-devel-homebrew

values.description:
For gazebo5 trusty debs for ROS:

* don't use bullet, since the system has less than the required version 2.82
* use ogre 1.8

The debs should also be rebuilt.
values.title: Fix trusty dependencies for vivid gazebo debbuild

summary.raw:
For gazebo5 trusty debs for ROS:

* don't use bullet, since the system has less than the required version 2.82
* use ogre 1.8

The debs should also be rebuilt.
summary.html:
For gazebo5 trusty debs for ROS:

  • don't use bullet, since the system has less than the required version 2.82
  • use ogre 1.8

The debs should also be rebuilt.

values.description:
Since we have a good variety of supported Ubuntu distributions across all the software, I'm removing the manual assignment of `UBUNTU_DISTROS` and build it from the different release repositories by getting the first level subdirectories.

You can add some extra distributions in the `UBUNTU_DISTROS_EXTRA` list in the case of need manual intervention.
values.title: Implement auto discover of supported distributions

summary.raw:

values.title: Do not install libgazebo5-dev by default

values.description:
This PRs implements a time framework to obtain time measure in the release-tools jenkins scripts. As a test case, I modified sdformat (chroot and docker) to use this new functions.

It creates a [directory in the jenkins workspace](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64_test_timing_4/ws/timing/) ($WORKSPACE/timing) and populates:

 * A csv file to be used by the plot plugin with all the data (aggregate).
 * One csv file for each stopwatch created.

The [testing example](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64_test_timing_4/plot/) compares chroot (runs 1 and 2) and docker (runs 3-6, 5-6 fixed a problem with the total time timer).
values.title: Implement time metrics in testing scripts

summary.raw:
This PRs implements a time framework to obtain time measure in the release-tools jenkins scripts. As a test case, I modified sdformat (chroot and docker) to use this new functions.

It creates a [directory in the jenkins workspace](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64_test_timing_4/ws/timing/) ($WORKSPACE/timing) and populates:

 * A csv file to be used by the plot plugin with all the data (aggregate).
 * One csv file for each stopwatch created.

The [testing example](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64_test_timing_4/plot/) compares chroot (runs 1 and 2) and docker (runs 3-6, 5-6 fixed a problem with the total time timer).
summary.html:
This PRs implements a time framework to obtain time measure in the release-tools jenkins scripts. As a test case, I modified sdformat (chroot and docker) to use this new functions.

It creates a directory in the jenkins workspace ($WORKSPACE/timing) and populates:

  • A csv file to be used by the plot plugin with all the data (aggregate).
  • One csv file for each stopwatch created.

The testing example compares chroot (runs 1 and 2) and docker (runs 3-6, 5-6 fixed a problem with the total time timer).

values.description: Needed to workaround some compilers problems due to the linking optimizations made in 4.8
values.title: Implement the option to force gcc to use version 4.8

summary.html: Needed to workaround some compilers problems due to the linking optimizations made in 4.8

values.title: Use sdformat3 released version for gazebo6 and later

values.description:
This implements the support to generate nightly and prerelease packages. There are two new repositories and one link:

 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable (linked to current ubuntu/ repository)
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly

There is a new parameter in the release.py script `--upload-to-repo` which if omitted defaults to stable repository to keep backwards compatibility with current uses. It accepts: stable | prerelease | nightly and send the `UPLOAD_TO_REPO` key to jenkins with that value.

The `repository_uploader` script did not require a lot of changes since reprepro works at directory level so we just need to change to repository directory and all the rest is the same. The `debbuild-base` scripts was slightly improved, but nothing substantial.

**Test run:**

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder-docker_test_upload/

**How to test:**

 * Add: `deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly trusty main` to sources.list
 * sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libsdformat3-dev


Still pending for next pull requests: run release.py daily from jenkins and port the cleanup script to S3 bucket.
values.title: Implement nightly/prerelease repositories uploads

summary.raw:
This implements the support to generate nightly and prerelease packages. There are two new repositories and one link:

 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable (linked to current ubuntu/ repository)
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease
 * packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly

There is a new parameter in the release.py script `--upload-to-repo` which if omitted defaults to stable repository to keep backwards compatibility with current uses. It accepts: stable | prerelease | nightly and send the `UPLOAD_TO_REPO` key to jenkins with that value.

The `repository_uploader` script did not require a lot of changes since reprepro works at directory level so we just need to change to repository directory and all the rest is the same. The `debbuild-base` scripts was slightly improved, but nothing substantial.

**Test run:**

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder-docker_test_upload/

**How to test:**

 * Add: `deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly trusty main` to sources.list
 * sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libsdformat3-dev


Still pending for next pull requests: run release.py daily from jenkins and port the cleanup script to S3 bucket.
summary.html:
This implements the support to generate nightly and prerelease packages. There are two new repositories and one link:

  • packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-stable (linked to current ubuntu/ repository)
  • packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-prerelease
  • packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly

There is a new parameter in the release.py script --upload-to-repo which if omitted defaults to stable repository to keep backwards compatibility with current uses. It accepts: stable | prerelease | nightly and send the UPLOAD_TO_REPO key to jenkins with that value.

The repository_uploader script did not require a lot of changes since reprepro works at directory level so we just need to change to repository directory and all the rest is the same. The debbuild-base scripts was slightly improved, but nothing substantial.

Test run:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat3-debbuilder-docker_test_upload/

How to test:

  • Add: deb http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu-nightly trusty main to sources.list
  • sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install libsdformat3-dev

Still pending for next pull requests: run release.py daily from jenkins and port the cleanup script to S3 bucket.

values.description:
The gazebo-default-doc job has been failing for a long time:

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-doc/

I just noticed a new problem related to not setting `GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION`, since it is getting the wrong version of sdformat for the default branch.
values.title: Set GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION in gazebo-default-doc.bash

summary.html:
The gazebo-default-doc job has been failing for a long time:

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-doc/

I just noticed a new problem related to not setting GAZEBO_MAJOR_VERSION, since it is getting the wrong version of sdformat for the default branch.
